text_cap: Our anglers have a very different sense of time from others
Ten minutes for others is just an ordinary ten minutes
during which many things can be done
But for our anglers
ten minutes are quite complicated
Take my last wild fishing experience
Just sat down and was about to start fishing
thinking of spending a few minutes to find the bottom
In the blink of an eye
ten minutes passed
Finally found the bottom and started baiting and casting
But the fish didn't bite
I wondered if the bait was wrong and changed the bait
which took a few more minutes
Then I started to be in a daze
staring at the float and thinking randomly
When I came back to my senses
another ten minutes had passed
It's especially true for beginners
They adjust the rod and line from time to time
and time slips away like this
Actually
don't be too concerned about time when fishing
Every step is the fun of fishing
Don't rush
enjoy the process slowly
Maybe the fish will bite inadvertently
